DOC.brief_summary: Diurnal variations in the cardiovascular system apparent in healthy individuals, are different in chronic kidney disease patients. Therefore, diurnal variations in arterial stiffness may also differ in chronic kidney disease patients. This study aims to identify and evaluate diurnal variations in arterial stiffness in chronic kidney disease patients and compare them to those in age matched healthy controls.
DOC.brief_title: Arterial Stiffness in Chronic Kidney Disease
DOC.criteria: Systolic blood pressure <160 whether or not on antihypertensive medication diastolic blood pressure <100mmHg whether or not on antihypertensive medication Chronic kidney disease stage 25 Systolic blood pressure ≥160mmHg Diastolic blood pressure ≥100mmhg Significant comorbidity (investigator opinion but to include alcoholism and terminal illness)
